user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of add_new_user_entry:
```c
static int
add_new_user_entry (const char *const username,
                    const char *const password,
                    const char *const realm,
                    int allow_area_1,
                    int allow_area_2)
{
  struct UserEntry *entry;
  enum MHD_Result res;

  if ((sizeof(user_ids) / sizeof(user_ids[0])) <= user_ids_used)
    return 0; /* No more space to add new entry */

  entry = user_ids + user_ids_used;

  entry->username = username;
  entry->realm = realm;

  res = MHD_YES;

  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5,
                                         username,
                                         realm,
                                         entry->userhash_md5,
                                         sizeof(entry->userhash_md5));
  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5,
                                           username,
                                           realm,
                                           password,
                                           entry->userdigest_md5,
                                           sizeof(entry->userdigest_md5));

  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256,
                                         username,
                                         realm,
                                         entry->userhash_sha256,
                                         sizeof(entry->userhash_sha256));
  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256,
                                           username,
                                           realm,
                                           password,
                                           entry->userdigest_sha256,
                                           sizeof(entry->userdigest_sha256));

  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res = MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256,
                                         username,
                                         realm,
                                         entry->userhash_sha512_256,
                                         sizeof(entry->userhash_sha512_256));
  if (MHD_NO != res)
    res =
      MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256,
                                       username,
                                       realm,
                                       password,
                                       entry->userdigest_sha512_256,
                                       sizeof(entry->userdigest_sha512_256));

  if (MHD_NO == res)
    return 0; /* Failure exit point */

  entry->allow_area_1 = allow_area_1;
  entry->allow_area_2 = allow_area_2;

  user_ids_used++;

  return ! 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No function parameter of add_new_user_entry is modified in this code. The parameters are: const char *const username, const char *const password, const char *const realm, int allow_area_1, int allow_area_2. None of these parameters are assigned to anywhere in the function body. Notes on potentially ambiguous sites that do NOT violate Rule 17.8: 
- entry->username = username; (This copies the value of the parameter into a structure member but does not modify the parameter itself.)
- entry->realm = realm; (Same as above.)
- Passing username, realm, and password to MHD_digest_auth_calc_* functions uses the parameters as rvalues; that does not modify the parameter variables of add_new_user_entry. The rule allows modification of the object pointed to by a pointer parameter, but forbids changing the pointer parameter itself; here the pointer parameters are declared const char *const, so the pointer itself is const and cannot be modified in this function.
- Using allow_area_1 and allow_area_2 in assignments to structure members (entry->allow_area_1 = allow_area_1; entry->allow_area_2 = allow_area_2;) reads the int parameters but does not modify them.
- Incrementing the global user_ids_used modifies a global, not any function parameter.
Therefore there are no code fragments in this function that should be investigated for violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
